abstracts.cdata!:
The El-Kala National Park and Wetlands
            Complex Management project will have three main objectives.
            First, it will mitigate the degradation of biodiversity
            within El Kala national park and wetlands complex. Second,
            it will establish a methodology and procedures for
            conducting environmental impact assessment studies. And
            third, it will serve as a model for the management and
            rational use of natural resources in populated, albeit
            protected, areas. The project will: 1) prepare and implement
            a national park and wetlands complex management plan; 2)
            launch priority surveys and studies to improve the basic
            knowledge of the immediate actions to stop further
            degradation of the environment; 3) initiate immediate
            actions to stop further degradation of the environment; 4)
            begin studies and adaptative research programs in specific
            sectors likely to trigger sustainable development from the
            use of natural resources; 5) develop environmental
            assessment capabilities; 6) launch environmental education
            and public awareness programs to muster the
            population's support; 7) introduce the participatory
            approach in the local communities and seek the participation
            of national and local non-governmental organizations; and 8)
            strengthen government institutions.
